sentence: [You've followed the fox out of the woods, but you're still unsure of where you are.]
[You see an old shrine ahead, and decide it's good place to stop and rest.]

author: mysterious fox
sentence: There you are, stranger.

author: mysterious fox
sentence: I was hoping, I'd find you again.

author: mysterious fox
sentence: Oh, are you wondering about this shrine? I'm told it's very important.

author: mysterious fox
sentence: Legends say a beautiful woman appears before souls of the dying, and beckons them to thier etharnal peace.

author: mysterious fox
sentence: They say she takes the form of a fox.

author: mysterious fox
sentence: You wouldn't know anybody like that, would you?
responses: I know a guy who moonlights as a transforming fox spirit.

author: mysterious woman
sentence: Ah, much better! I don't mind being a fox so much, but I much prefer this form.

author: mysterious woman
sentence: What? Were you expecting something more... Monstrous? Hee hee.

author: mysterious woman
sentence: No spirit would follow a fox demon int the aferlife. At least not willingly. But me? They'll follow me.

author: ahri
sentence: You can call me Ahri, by the way. I'm this world's spirit of salvation. Don't worry about me helping you out of those woods... It's just what I do!

author: ahri
sentence: I did have a question for you, though... Are you sure don't remember how you got here? Nothing at all?
responses: I was being chased by a wisecracking demonic clown.

author: ahri
sentence: A bright light? Hmmmm. I've heard of that before, but...

author: ahri
sentence: Darkness, you say? It's not uncommon, but that could mean...

author: ahri
sentence: Ooo, that sounds scarry! Mybe you're dead after all!

author: ahri
sentence: ... Well, either way, you're here now. And if I can't tell if you're alive or dead, we might have a real problem on our hands.

author: ahri
sentence: You're the problem, for clarity's sake.

author: ahri
sentence: Did you know people used to flock to this shrine? In the real world, they tell fables of the fox that guides souls to the afterlife.

author: ahri
sentence: But here, time doesn't flow the same way it does for humans. We're defined by the lives and deaths of mortals, but nothing around us ever ages or changes...

author: ahri
sentence: It's always today, yesterday, and tomorrow. Last year and next year. Winter, summer, spring and fall.

author: ahri
sentence: People like you live, and one day die. But just like the world itself, the spirits keep existing. The same way we always have.

author: ahri
sentence: Just like this old shrine here! Do you think they got my good side?
responses: Every side is your good side.

author: ahri
sentence: Calm down, stranger. We barely know each other, and you might be dead! So that's two points in the negative column.

author: ahri
sentence: It is, isn't it? My side profile is very striking.

author: ahri
sentence: I think the moss ads an air of sophistication. And regular air! That's photosynthesis.

author: ahri
sentence: The reson I'm telling you this... is that if you're supposed to be alive right now, you can't stay here for long.

author: ahri
sentence: Years will go by in days. Decade in years. By the time you've retruned, your whole world will be changed.

author: ahri
sentence: And if my hunch is right, you'll only be the first. That is, if you're not dead. Which you still might be. No conclusive answer there yet.

author: ahri
sentence: I'm going to check on something. But I still don't know you very well... so here's what I'll ask.

author: ahri
sentence: The soulsof the dead are starting to get... misdirected? I'm not sure your kkind has a word for it. They're not going to their appointed place in the afterlife.

author: ahri
sentence: In fact, I'm not seeing some of them at all.

author: ahri
sentence: I need you to find some of those lost souls and guide them to my shrine. I'll handle the rest.

author: ahri
sentence: If you can do that, I'll help you get home. And if not, well...

author: ahri
sentence: I guess we'll be seeing a lot more of each other. Hee hee.

author: ahri
